pr_title: Change 'left outer join' to 'join' with t_cryptotransferlists

timeline.message:
Remove 'left outer join' on t_cryptotransferlists in transaction.js

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText:
i believe we can also remove left outer join with t_transaction_results?
We don't handle unknown result type in importer.
Not same can be said for t_transaction_types though, so still need left outer join there.
timeline.author: apeksharma
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ const boilerplateSufffix = ` join t_transactions t on tlist.consensus_timestamp
     join t_entities enode on enode.id = t.fk_node_acc_id

replies.bodyText: Or maybe we can't. I'll leave it as is. Not worth the time to figure since performance impact would be none. (both txn results and txn types table are so small that they'll be in-memory)
replies.author: apeksharma

replies.bodyText: Did you see an improvement in performance for queries?
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: During regular developments, one doesn't do a/b perf test for 'left outer join' vs 'join', so no need here either. Neither I am curious since i don't expect to see any gains :). Just closing the ticket. Conventional wisdom is to not use left outer join since it forces query optimizer to join in certain way.
replies.author: apeksharma

timeline.message:
Remove 'left outer join' on t_cryptotransferlists in transaction.js

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>
